Key Match Events: Endrick scored the only goal of the match, converting a rebound after Vinícius Júnior was denied by Jordan Pickford.
Lewis Dunk made an error leading to Brazil's goal.
Kyle Walker was forced off with a hamstring problem early in the match.
Vinícius Júnior was denied a goal by Jordan Pickford and later by Kyle Walker.
Lucas Paquetá struck the post with a sidefoot shot in the 35th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate missed key players including Harry Kane, Luke Shaw, and Bukayo Saka.
Brazil's new manager, Dorival Júnior, warned that he did not have a magic wand to fix the team's issues.
There was pre-match talk about Brazil being in crisis and struggling to connect with fans back home.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate was left with much to ponder before the next friendly against Belgium.
The smattering of boos upon the full-time whistle was inevitable, almost traditional.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The atmosphere inside a sold-out Wembley was flat, with fans resorting to throwing paper planes.
Brazil's physical force pushed the boundaries, with Lucas Paquetá avoiding a second yellow card for a trip on Jude Bellingham.
